cantopenlastprojecterror.title: Unable to open last {project}
cantopenlastprojecterror.text: Unable to open last edited {project}, please select another {project} or create a new one.

startup.alreadyrunningerror: It appears that {QW} is already running.  Please close the other instance before starting {QW} again.

importfile: Drop the file to begin the import

noobjectselectedpanel.title: No ${objectnames.singular.chapter}/${objectnames.singular.asset}/panel selected
noobjectselectedpanel.text:
You are seeing this because no ${objectnames.singular.chapter}/${objectnames.singular.asset}/panel has been selected.

This usually happens when you have just deleted the item you were viewing.

To continue, just select an item from the sidebar.

settingsmenu.:comment: These items are used for the 'project' menu, the cog icon on a window, they are reused by most project 'viewers' hence the most frequently used items are defined here.

objectnames.:comment: These are the names of objects within the interface.  The user can change most of these.  They are split into singular and plural forms.

popup.title: Edit Object Names
popup.text: After saving any changes to names will appear when you next open the ${objectnames.singular.project}.

popup.title: Confirm name changes?
popup.text:
Warning! To reset the object names back to the defaults the ${objectnames.singular.project} must first be saved then reopened.

Do you wish to continue?

confirmchange.actionerror: Unable to update the object names.

popup.title: Confirm name changes?
popup.text:
Warning! To change the object names the ${objectnames.singular.project} must first be saved then reopened.

Do you wish to continue?

popup.title: Function unavailable
popup.text:
Sorry, you cannot view ${objectnames.plural.note}, ${objectnames.plural.outlineitem} and ${objectnames.plural.scene} while distraction free mode is enabled.

Click here to find out why

firstusewizard.title: Welcome to {QW}
firstusewizard.text: Welcome to {QW}, this page will help you get started.  Don't worry, there are only a couple of questions and then you can get started on your first ${objectnames.singular.project}.

newproject.title: ${objectnames.singular.project} details
newproject.text: Enter the name of the ${objectnames.singular.project} below and select the directory where it should be saved.

selectprojectdb.title: Select your ${objectnames.plural.project} directory
selectprojectdb.text: Use the finder below to find the directory where your {projects} database file is stored. The file is called %1$s
selectprojectdb.:comment.text: %1$s is the file name of the projects database.

existing.title: Find your ${objectnames.plural.project}
existing.text: If you would like {QW} to find your ${objectnames.plural.project} then click ${actions.finish} below.

labels.manual: I know where my ${objectnames.plural.project} database is

decide.title: Your first ${objectnames.singular.project}
decide.text: If you already have your story in a .docx or .doc file then use the import option below, otherwise use the create option.  You can also just drag your .docx or .doc file onto this window.

labels.notfirst: Not your first ${objectnames.singular.project}?  Click here to find your ${objectnames.plural.project}.

selectfile.title: Select a file to import
selectfile.text: Microsoft Word files (.doc and .docx) are supported. Please check the import guide to ensure your file has the correct format.

selectitems.title: Select the items you wish to import
selectitems.text: Check the items below to ensure that they match what is in your file.  The first and last sentences of the description (if present) are shown for each item.

start.title: Select the spell checker language
start.text:
Welcome to {QW}}, this wizard will help you get started.

First, select the language you would like to use for the spell checker. You can download additional languages in the Options panel later.

addedit.:comment: These items relate to both the add and edit parts of note creation.

type.tooltip: Add a new Type by entering a value in the field.

writingtargetreachedpopup.title: Writing targets reached
writingtargetreachedpopup.text:
You have reached the following writing targets by writing %1$s words.
    %2$s
Well done and keep it up!
writingtargetreachedpopup.:comment.text: %1$s is the number of words written.  %2$s is the types of target reached.

chaptersoverwcmaximum.single: %1$s {chapter} is over the word count maximum of %2$s words, click to view the {chapter}.
chaptersoverwcmaximum.:comment.single: %1$s is the number of chapters over the maximum. %2$s is the maximum word count.
chaptersoverwcmaximum.multiple: %1$s {chapters} are over the word count maximum of %2$s words, click to view the {chapters}.
chaptersoverwcmaximum.:comment.multiple: %1$s is the number of chapters over the maximum count.  %2$s is the maximum word count.

chaptersoverreadabilitymaximum.single: %1$s {chapter} is over one of the readability targets, click to view the {chapter}.
chaptersoverreadabilitymaximum.:comment.single: %1$s is the number of chapters over the readability target(s).
chaptersoverreadabilitymaximum.multiple: %1$s {chapters} are over one of the readability targets, click to view the {chapters}.
chaptersoverreadabilitymaximum.:comment.multiple: %1$s is the number of chapters over the readability target(s).

popup.title: {Chapters} over word count target
popup.multipleoverlimit: %1$s {chapters} are over the target word count, click to view them.
popup.:comment.multipleoverlimit: %1$s is the number of chapters over the limit.
popup.singleoverlimit: {Chapter} %1$s is over the target word count, click to view it.
popup.:comment.singleoverlimit: %1$s is the name of the chapter over the limit.

fontunavailable.text:
The font %1$s selected for use in {chapters} is not available on this computer.

To select a new font, switch to a {chapter} tab then click here to change the text properties.
fontunavailable.:comment.text: The %1$s is the name of the font that cannot be found.

functionunavailable.title: Function unavailable
functionunavailable.text:
Sorry, this function is only available when your spellchecker language is English.

Click here to contact me to help add support for your language

textarea.:comment.maxchars: %1$s is the maximum number of characters allowed.  This message is usually used for text boxes to indicate how many characters are allowed to be entered.
textarea.:comment.charsremaining: %1$s is the number of characters that can still be entered into the text area.  This message is appended to [maxchars] and shown below the text area.
textarea.:comment.charsover: %1$s is the number of characters over the maximum.  This message is appeded to [maxchars] and shown below the text area.

basic.title: The basic details
basic.text: Enter the name and plural name (what do you call lots of your object) for your object. For example, you might call it Widget and Widgets.

fields.title: Add the fields you want the object to have
fields.text: Use the button below to add a new field for your object.  Drag-n-drop the fields to change the order of them.

layout.title: How should the fields be displayed
layout.text: Finally, and this step is optional, select how you want the fields to be displayed.  Remember you can change any of this information later so don't worry about it too much for now.

userobjects.:comment: This section relates to the adding/editing of custom objects by the user.

edit.actionerror: Unable to update the object type.

view.text: The layout tells {QW} how you want to display the fields for your %1$s. Certain fields like the object description and object image are given special locations in the layouts. For Columns of fields it just means that the fields are laid out in the order given in the Fields tab.
view.:comment.text: %1$s is the object type plural name.

layouts.0: Fields are laid out in a single column.
layouts.1: The object image, if present, is displayed in the top left corner and the object description is shown to the right.  Two columns of fields are displayed underneath.
layouts.2: The object image is shown in the top left corner with the object description underneath.  The other fields are shown in a column on the right.
layouts.3: Two columns of fields are displayed.
layouts.4: The object image is shown in the top right corner with the object description underneath.  The other fields are shown in a column on the left.
layouts.5: The object description is shown in a column on the right, all others fields are shown in a column on the left.
layouts.6: The object description is shown in a column on the left, all others fields are shown in a column on the right.
layouts.7: The object description is shown in a column on the left, the object image is shown in the top right corner with all other fields in a column underneath.
layouts.8: The object image is shown in the top left corner with the object description in a column on the right.  The other object fields are shown underneath the object image.

view.text: Use the button below to add a new field for your %1$s.  Drag-n-drop the fields to change the order of them.  Use the layout tab above to change how the fields are laid out and displayed.

add.tooltip: Click to add a new field

name.novalue: The name of the field must be specified.
name.:comment.valueexists: %1$s is the name of the field.

name.novalue: The name of the field must be specified.
name.:comment.valueexists: %1$s is the name of the field.

confirmpopup.title: Remove field
confirmpopup.text: Remove this field?  Note: any data associated with the field will also be removed.

view.text: Use the button below to change the general information for your %1$s such as the name and what icons to use.

labels.name: Name
labels.:comment.bigicon: %1$s the width of the icon, this is usually 24.
labels.:comment.smallicon: %1$s the width of the icon, this is usually 16.

name.valueexists: You already have a type called: %1$s.

plural.valueexists: You already have a type called: %1$s.

popup.title: Warning!
popup.text: Note: the image you have selected will be resized to: %1$spx by %1$spx when saved.
popup.:comment.text: %1$s the width of the icon, this is usually 24.

popup.title: Warning!
popup.text: Note: the image you have selected will be resized to: %1$spx by %1$spx when saved.
popup.:comment.text: %1$s the width of the icon, this is usually 16.

errors.invalidemail: Email does not appear to be valid.
errors.:comment.general: %1$s is the list of errors that need to be corrected by the user.  Each error is wrapped in a html li tag.

image.tooltip: Click to view the full image

objectimage.tooltip: Click to view the full image

othernames.tooltip: Separate each name/alias with a new line, comma or a semi-colon.

errors.invalidvalue: %1$s does not appear to be a number.
errors.:comment.invalidvalue: %1$s is the value that doesn't appear to be valid.
errors.:comment.max: %1$s is the value entered by the user.  %2$s is the maximum allowed value.
errors.:comment.min: %1$s is the value entered by the user.  %2$s is the minimum allowed value.

errors.:comment.novalue: %1$s is the name of the field.
errors.:comment.valueexists: %1$s is the object type name, %2$s is the name of the object with the name.

othernames.tooltip: Separate each name/alias with a comma or a semi-colon.

types.:comment.descriptionseparator: This is used to separator the various parts of the description for a field.  For instance there might be 'Single-line text; Is other names/aliases for the furby' as the description of the field.

max.greaterthanmin: The maximum date must be after the minimum.

default.greaterthanmin: The default date must be after the minimum.
default.lessthanmax: The default date must be before the maximum.

max.invalidvalue: The maximum value doesn't look like a number.
max.greaterthanmin: The maximum value must be greater than the minimum.

min.invalidvalue: The minimum value doesn't look like a number.

bulletpoints.tooltip: Check this box to display the text in the field as a series of bullet points.  Each separate line of text will be treated as a bullet point.

select.tooltip: Enter the items that can be selected, separate each item by a comma (,) or a semi-colon (;).

errors.novalue: At least one item must be specified.

allowmulti.text: Allow multiple items to be selected

more.:comment.text: %1$s is the number of other items, the first five are shown.

othernames.:comment.text: %1$s is the object type name. This is the text for a checkbox allowing the user to mark the field as other names/aliases for the object.  It is also used as part of the field description to indicate what the field is used for.
othernames.tooltip: Check this box to mark this field as other name or aliases for the %1$s.  Separate each name/alias with a comma or a semi-colon.

othernames.:comment.text: %1$s is the object type name. This is the text for a checkbox allowing the user to mark the field as other names/aliases for the object.  It is also used as part of the field description to indicate what the field is used for.
othernames.tooltip: Check this box to mark this field as other name or aliases for the %1$s.  Separate each name/alias with a comma or a semi-colon.

bulletpoints.tooltip: Check this box to display the text in the field as a series of bullet points.  Each separate line of text will be treated as a bullet point.

manageitems.:comment: This is general purpose 'manage these things' actions.  It is used as the base for managing project statuses, the personal dictionary and note types.

newitems.title: New Items
newitems.text: Enter the new items to add below, separate each item with a comma or semi-colon.

table.title: Current Items
table.tooltip: Double click to edit, press Enter when done.

newversionavailable.text: A new version of {QW} is available. View the changes.

restart.title: Restart {QW}
restart.text:
Version %1$s of {QW} has been downloaded. To complete the upgrade you must exit {QW}, the installer will then guide you through the rest of the upgrade process.

Would you like to exit now?

download.start: Downloading upgrade file for new version: %1$s
download.inprogress: Downloading upgrade file for new version %1$s - %2$s of %3$s bytes
download.:comment.inprogress: %1$s is the new version id, $2$s is the number of bytes downloaded, %3$s is the size of the download file in bytes.

errors.cantcreatetemporaryfile: Unable to create the temporary file for the download.
errors.digestinvalid: Digest calculated from download file is not the same as gained from the server.
errors.unabletodownload: Unable to download the upgrade file.
errors.general: Unable to download/install the new version. Click here to download the latest version from the {QW} website
errors.:comment.general: %1$s is the url for the Quoll Writer website.

viewitem.:comment: This is a general purpose 'View this thing' action.  It is reused by a number of functions, such as editing a scene or outline item.
viewitem.:comment.actionerror: %1$s is the object type name of the item that cannot be viewed.

linkitem.:comment: This is a general purpose 'View this thing to something else' action.  It is reused by a number of functions, such as linking a scene or outline item.
linkitem.tooltip: Click to link this %1$s to other items/objects
linkitem.:comment.tooltip: %1$s is the object type name of the item.

edititem.:comment: This is a general purpose 'Edit this thing' action.  It is reused by a number of functions, such as viewing a scene or outline item.
edititem.:comment.actionerror: %1$s is the object type name of the item that cannot be edited.
edititem.:comment.tooltip: %1$s is the object type name of the item.

deleteitem.:comment: This is a general purpose 'Delete this thing' action.  It is reused by a number of functions, such as deleting a chapter or warmup or project.
deleteitem.title: Delete %1$s
deleteitem.:comment.title: %1$s is the type of thing that is to be deleted.
deleteitem.text: To delete %1$s %2$s please enter the word ${deleteitem.confirmword} into the box below.%3s
deleteitem.:comment.text: %1$s is the type of thing that is to be deleted.  %2$s is the name of the thing, such as chapter name.  %3s is an optional warning that some delete functions display to warn the user.  The confirmword value is the one used for confirmation of the deletion.  It should be an affirmative value, such as 'Yes' or 'Ok', i.e. short and fast to enter but indicates that the user agrees with the action.  When checked the case of the value entered will be ignored, so YES, Yes, or yes would work.
deleteitem.errorlabel: Please enter the word ${deleteitem.confirmword} to confirm the deletion.
deleteitem.:comment.tooltip: %1$s is the object type name of the item.

show.title: Synonyms for: %1$s
show.:comment.title: %1$s is the word being searched for.

items.:comment:find: %1$s is the word to find the synonyms for.
items.:comment.nosynonyms: %1$s is the word we are looking for.

on.tooltip: Click to turn the spell checker on

off.tooltip: Click to turn the spell checker off

newwords.title: New Words
newwords.text: Enter the new words to add below, separate the words with commas or semi-colons.

achievementspanel.title: ${names.achievements}
achievementspanel.text: Listed below are all the achievements you have found/reached.  Some of the achievements apply to each {project} you create, others are just for general usage of {QW}.  There are also a number of hidden achievements, can you find them?

sectiontitles.:comment.user: %1$s is the number of achievements the user has reached.  %2$s is the number of possible user level achievements.
sectiontitles.:comment.project: %1$s is the number of achievements the project has reached.  %2$s is the number of possible project level achievements.

swear50.name: Language Timothy!
swear50.:comment.name: This achievement is for the English language only and doesn't need to be translated.

exclamation5.name: I'm not crazy!
exclamation5.:comment.name: This achievement is for the English language only and doesn't need to be translated.
exclamation5.description: Use ! 5 times or more in a {chapter}.

speechverbs10.name: Variation on a theme
speechverbs10.:comment.name: This achievement is for the English language only and doesn't need to be translated.
speechverbs10.description: Use 10 different speech verbs in a {chapter}.

firstsentence.name: I've started so I'll finish
firstsentence.description: Write the first sentence of the first {chapter}.

chapter5over5000.name: {Chapters} are for the weak
chapter5over5000.description: Have 5 {chapters} that are 5,000 words or more.

chapterover5000.name: Well... a lot happened
chapterover5000.description: Have a {chapter} that is 5,000 words or more.

hourwrite.name: My fingers ache
hourwrite.description: Write for 60 minutes (with only 5 minute breaks).

sessionwords1000.name: On a roll
sessionwords1000.description: Write 1,000 words or more in one session.

sessionwords2000.name: Tearing up the keys
sessionwords2000.description: Write 2,000 words or more in one session.

sessionwords5000.name: Pact with the devil
sessionwords5000.description: Write 5,000 words or more in one session.

session5sessions500words.name: Steaming ahead
session5sessions500words.description: Over the course of 7 days have 5 or more writing sessions where you write 500 words or more.

sessionEditChapters3.name: A little of this, a little of that

renameproject.name: A Book by Any Other Name

spellcheckon.name: I'll be glad to be rid of them

typewritersoundon.name: Old School
typewritersoundon.description: Turn on the typewriter sound and listen to the clackity clack of years gone by.

checkwordcounts.name: How am I doing?
checkwordcounts.description: You checked the word counts, have you written as much as you think?

wordcounthistory.name: Historian
wordcounthistory.description: You checked the word count history, are those lines going up?

addidea20.name: So many ideas, so little time

rateideas.name: Some are more equal than others

addlocation20.name: All your base are belong to us

addcharacter10.name: I'm sorry I've completely forgotten your name

problemfinderunignore.name: On second thoughts...
problemfinderunignore.description: Un-ignore a problem found by the ${names.problemfinder}.

changespellchecklanguage.name: They talk so funny over there

movechapter.name: First we do this, then this

spellcheckreplace.name: Correct me if I'm wrong
spellcheckreplace.description: Change a word via the spellchecker.

addeditneedednote5.description: I'll fix it next time round.

addeditneedednote10.name: Need a fresh pot of coffee

personaldictionaryaddword.name: I'll be needing that later
personaldictionaryaddword.description: Add a word to your personal dictionary.

managepersonaldictionary.name: I'll spell it my way damnit

showfind.name: I know I put it somewhere

aliascharacter.name: They call me Smith
aliascharacter.description: Have an alias for a character.

ideaboardbackgroundchange.name: Seeing my ideas in a new way

usestyle.name: A little salt and pepper
usestyle.description: Use bold, italic or underline on the text.

addownprompt5.name: I amuse myself
addownprompt5.description: Write 5 of your own warm-up prompts.

warmupwordsreached.name: Beating the clock
warmupwordsreached.description: Do a warm-up and write the selected number of words before the timer runs out.

warmuptimerrestart.name: I'm on a roll
warmuptimerrestart.description: Continue the ${objectnames.singular.warmup} after the timer runs out/word count is reached.

settingschange.name: Setting up
settingschange.description: Change the colors/settings in normal mode.

fullscreentimerstart.name: Stay on target
fullscreentimerstart.description: Use the timer in full screen mode.

fullscreensettingschange.name: My way or the highway
fullscreensettingschange.description: Change the colors/settings for full screen mode.

fullscreensbgchange.name: Window of the soul
fullscreensbgchange.description: Change the size of the display and/or the background transparency in full screen mode.

fullscreensbgimage.name: My own private Zen
fullscreensbgimage.description: Change the background image in full screen mode.

acceptinvite3.name: I'm not your guys, buddies... no wait...

inviteaccepted.name: Not alone in this
inviteaccepted.description: Receive an invite acceptance from a ${objectnames.singular.contact}.

acceptprojectinvite.name: I'm your [wo]man
acceptprojectinvite.description: Accept an invite to edit a ${objectnames.singular.project}.

tips.1: {QW} has a Patreon page. If you want to help speed up development why not consider donating? Click here to view the Patreon page
tips.2: Did you know you can keep track of how much of a {chapter} you have edited? Just right click at any point in the chapter and select [Chapter] Edit then [edit-point] Set Edit Point.
tips.3: Don't like what things are called? Click here to change them.
tips.4: There is an option to compress the right click menu you see when editing a {chapter}. Click here to view options.
tips.5: Don't like the position of the tabs? Change it in the options. Click here to view options.
tips.6: Want to see where you are writing? Enable writing line highlighting in the text properties. Click here to view the text properties now.
tips.7: Want to change something? Check out the options, there might be a setting for it.
tips.8: Changing the setting of an option will take effect straight away, no need to save.
tips.9:
Want to work in full screen mode? Click to enter full screen mode now.
You can also press F5 or use the [fullscreen,fullscreen] button on the toolbar to enter full screen mode.
tips.10: Can't remember what the awesome was added in this release? Click to see what's new.
tips.11: Got writer's block? Why not try a {warmup} exercise? To do a {warmup} at any time select [warmups]${project.settingsmenu.items.dowarmup} from the {project} menu.
tips.12:
Want to record your ideas? Click to open the ${names.ideaboard}.
You can open the ${names.ideaboard} at any time by selecting [idea]${project.settingsmenu.items.ideaboard}.
tips.13: Have you seen the user guide? Click to view the guide. You can access the online help at any time from the {project} menu, then select [help]${project.settingsmenu.items.help} then [help]${project.settingsmenu.items.viewuserguide}.
tips.14.1:
Want to know how many words you've written? Click to see the word counts now.
You can also use Ctrl+W or the [wordcount] button from the toolbar to see how many words you've written.
tips.14.2: Want to know how many words you've written? Press Ctrl+W when editing a chapter or use the [wordcount] button from the toolbar to see how many words you've written.
tips.15:
Want to know see how many words you've written over time? Click to see the word count history now.
Press Ctrl+W or use the [wordcount] button from the toolbar then [wordcount]View Detail to view the history.
tips.16:
Want to manage the words in your personal dictionary? Click to manage your personal dictionary now.
The dictionary can be accessed from the project menu then select [edit-properties]Project Options and the {Chapter} tab.
tips.17:
Sick of those little red lines? Click to turn the spellchecker off.
Press Ctrl+L when editing a chapter or use the [spellchecker] button on the toolbar to turn the spellchecker on or off.
tips.18:
Want to keep track of your achievements? Click to check your achievements now.
You can track your progress at any time by selecting [achievement]${project.settingsmenu.items.achievements} from the {project} menu.
tips.19: Like to use the keyboard rather than the mouse? Click to view the shortcuts.
tips.20:
You can import Microsoft Word files into your {project}. Click to import a file.
You can also select [project-import]${project.settingsmenu.items.importfileorproject} from the {project} menu to import.
tips.21:
You can export your {project} to a number of different file formats? Click to export your {project}.
You can also select [project-export]${project.settingsmenu.items.exportproject} from the {project} menu to export.
tips.22:
Want to improve your writing and find problems with the text? Click to view the problem finder.
The problem finder can be accessed from the [tools] tools menu on the toolbar then selecting [eye]${names.problemfinder}.
tips.23:
You can use the problem finder in full screen mode. Click to view the problem finder in full screen mode now.
Full screen mode can be accessed from the toolbar by selecting [fullscreen] or pressing F5. The ${names.problemfinder} can be accessed from the [tools] tools menu on the toolbar then selecting [eye]Find Problems or using the shortcut Ctrl+Shift+P.
tips.24:
Want to check how readable your prose is? Click to view the check the readability now.
You can also check the readability by opening the word counts via Ctrl+W or use the [wordcount] button on the toolbar.
tips.25:
Don't like the font or font size? Click to change the text properties.
The text properties can be accessed from the [tools] menu on the toolbar then select [edit-properties]Edit Text Properties.
tips.26.1: Want to find a synonym?  Highlight a word while editing a {chapter} and right click.
tips.26.2: Want to find a synonym?  Highlight a word and right click.
tips.27:
Missing the sound of a typewriter? Click to try out the typewriter sound.
You can turn the sound on or off (and change it) in the How things look and sound section of the options.
tips.28:
{Warmups} can be converted into {projects}. Click to do a {warmup} now.
You can do a {warmup} at any time, just select [warmups]${project.settingsmenu.items.dowarmup} from the {project} menu.
tips.29: In full screen mode you can change the size of the writing area and how transparent the background is?  Just move your cursor to the top of the screen to see the options.
tips.30: Did you know that in full screen mode you can change the color of the text and the background of the writing area? <a href='action:fullscreen'>Click to enter full screen mode now.
tips.31: Did you know that in full screen mode you can set an image for the background? Click to enter full screen mode now.
tips.32:
Looking to find where a word or term is mentioned? Click to open the find.
You can open the find with Ctrl+F or select [find]Find from the project menu at any time.

ignore.checkbox: Check the box to ignore this problem.

items.find: Find all problems of this type

toomanyclauses.:comment.text: %1$s is the number of clauses.  %2$s is the max value configured.

sentencecomplexity.:comment.text: %1$s is the ratio for the sentence.  %2$s is the max value configured.

sentencelength.:comment.text: %1$s is the number of words in the sentence.  %2$s is the max value configured.

paragraphreadability.:comment.fk: %1$s is the FK value for the paragraph.  %2$s is the max FK value configured.
paragraphreadability.:comment.fr: %1$s is the FR value for the paragraph.  %2$s is the max FR value configured.
paragraphreadability.:comment.gf: %1$s is the GF value for the paragraph.  %2$s is the max GF value configured.

paragraphlength.:comment.wordtext: %1$s is the number of words in the paragraph.  %2$s is the max value configured.
paragraphlength.:comment.sentencetext: %1$s is the number of sentences in the paragraph.  %2$s is the max value configured.

doubleword.:comment.wordtext: %1$s and %2$s are replaced with the duplicated word.
doubleword.:comment.punctuationtext: %1$s and %2$s are replaced with the punctuation mark.

passivesentence.:comment.text: The %1$s is replaced with the word(s) found.

adverb.text: Use of adverb: %1$s to modify speech verb: %2$s
adverb.:comment.text: %1$s is the adverb, %2$s is the speech verb being modified.

wordfinder.:comment.text: %1$s is the word/phrase that is found.  %2$s is the suffix showing where the word/phrase was found.

suffixes.:comment.notindialogue: The %1$s is either start or end.
suffixes.:comment.indialogue: The %1$s is either start or end.

removespeechverbs.tooltip: Click to remove the selected speech verbs

labels.:comment.separate: Commas and semi-colons are used to separate the verbs.

wordfinder.nowordserror: Please enter at least one word or symbol.

description.:comment.anywhere: The %1$s is replaced with one of the dialogue suffixes.
description.:comment.insentence: %1$s is replaced with either start or end, %2$s is replaced with one of the dialogue suffixes.

Click to add a new Paragraph Structure rule

info.tooltip: Click to show/hide the description of this rule

importproject.title: Import a File or ${objectnames.singular.project}

errors.:comment.unabletosave: The %1$s is the name of the item that is trying to be saved.
errors.:comment.unabletocreateproject: The %1$s is the name of the project trying to be created.
errors.nofileselected: Please select a file to import.
errors.filenotexist: File does not exist, please select a valid file.
errors.dirselected: Selection is a directory, please select a file instead.

importproject.help: It is recommended that you read the guide to importing prior to using this function if you are importing a file. The import expects the file(s) to be in a certain format.
importproject.:comment.moretextindicator: The ellipsis here, in English, indicates that there is more text available.  i.e. there is more to come in this ...

importcompletepopup.title: ${actions.import} complete
importcompletepopup.text: The items have been imported into your {project}

newproject.title: Enter the new {project} details
newproject.text: To create a new {project} enter the name below and select the directory where it should be saved.

decide.title: What would you like to do?

options.:comment.addtoproject: The %1$s is the name of the current project.

selectitems.title: Select the items you wish to import
selectitems.text: Check the items below to ensure that they match what is in your file.  The first and last sentences of the description (if present) are shown for each item.%1$s
selectitems.:comment.help: The %1$s is replaced with the {textextra} text if the user has selected 'Add to {project} for importing.  If new project is selected then blank text is used.
selectitems.textextra: Only items not already in the {project} will be listed.

selectfile.title: Select a file to import
selectfile.text: Microsoft Word files (.doc and .docx) are supported. Please check the import guide to ensure your file has the correct format.

choose.title: What would you like to import?
choose.text: Select whether you wish to import from a file or from one of your {projects}.

exportproject.help: This wizard allows you to export the information in your {project}.

exportcompletepopup.title: Your {Project} has been exported
exportcompletepopup.:comment.text: %1$s is the name of the project.  %2$s is a special link that tells QW to open the folder where the project has been exported to.  %3$s is the folder path.  It is recommended that you DO NOT change the link in any way.

sectiontitles.:comment.notes: %1$s is replaced with the name of the project or chapter.
sectiontitles.:comment.scenesoutlineitems: %1$s is replaced with the name of the project or chapter.
sectiontitles.:comment.chapterinfo: %1$s is replaced with the name of the project or chapter.
sectiontitles.:comment.assets: %1$s is replaced with the name of the project or chapter.

wheretosave.title: Select the file type and directory to save to

finder.title: Select a directory to export to
finder.tooltip: Click to find a directory to export to
finder.label: Directory

selectitems.title: Select the items you wish to export
selectitems.text: Select the items you wish to export, if you select any {chapters} then any associated {notes} and {outlineitems} will also be exported.

howtosave.title: How should the selected items be saved
howtosave.text: The items can be saved in either a single file or in one file per type of item.  Any {notes} and {outlineitems} will be saved in separate files.

types.onefileperitemtype: One file per type of item

closeproject.:comment.actionerror: The %1$s is the name of the project.

confirmpopup.title: Save changes before exiting?
confirmpopup.text:
The following items have unsaved changes (click on an item to go to the relevant tab):
    %1$s
Do you wish to save the changes before exiting?
confirmpopup.:comment.text: The %1$s is a list of items that the user can click on to open up the tab with unsaved changes.  It is recommended you DO NOT change this.  Each item will be formatted within a li html tag.

confirmpopup.title: ${actions.save} before closing?
confirmpopup.:comment.text: The %1$s is the title of the panel that has changes.

firsttimepopup.title: Welcome to Distraction Free Mode

Since this is your first time using Distraction Free Mode it is recommended you spend a bit of time reading about how it works. It may work in different ways to how you expect and/or how other writing applications implement similar modes.

Click here to find out more

distractionfreemode.exit: Click to exit distraction free mode

backups.nobackups: Click to view the backups directory

show.actionerror: Unable to show list of backups.

new.actionerror: Unable to create a new backup.

popup.title: Confirm restore
popup.text:
Please confirm you wish to restore {project} %1$s using the backup file %2$s.

A backup of the {project} will be created before the restore occurs.
popup.:comment.text: %1$s is the project name.  %2$s is the path to the file that will be used for the restore.

confirmpopup.title: {Project} restored
confirmpopup.text: The {project} has been restored from file %1$s.
confirmpopup.:comment.text: %1$s is the path to file used for the restore.

confirmpopup.title: Confirm delete
confirmpopup.text: Please confirm you wish to delete backup file %1$s.

next.tooltip: Click to view the next tip

stop.tooltip: Click to stop showing tips when {QW} starts

popup.title: Stop showing tips?
popup.text:
Stop showing tips when {QW} starts?

They can enabled at any time in the Options panel.

popup.title: What's new in version %1$s
popup.:comment.title: %1$s is the current QW version number.

whatsnew.text: Welcome to version %1$s. This window describes the various changes that have been made since the last version and lets you setup new features. You can also see the full list of changes online.
whatsnew.:comment.text: %1$s is the version number.  %2$s is the version number but with all . (dot) replaced with _ (underscores) for use in a url.  It is recommended that you do not modify the href value.

createwarmupsproject.title: {Warmups} {project}
createwarmupsproject.text: A {Warmups} {project} will now be created to hold your {warmups}.

dowarmup.starterror: o_O  The timer can't be unlimited for both time and words.
dowarmup.allpromptsexcluded: You have excluded all the prompts.
dowarmup.noshowpromptagain: Do not show this prompt again

weblinks.tooltip: Click to see a list of websites that have writing prompts
weblinks.visitlink: Click to go to the %1$s website (%2$s)
weblinks.:comment.visitlink: %1$s is the name of the website, %2$s is the url of the website.

previousprompt.tooltip: Go back to the previous prompt

linkedto.:comment.nolinksedit: This text is shown as a clickable link when there are no Links set for the object.  Clicking on the link will show the edit form.

edit.tooltip: Click to change what other objects this %1$s is linked to
edit.:comment.tooltip: %1$s is the object type name for the object.

save.:comment.tooltip: %1$s is the object type name of the asset.

errormessage.title: Oops, an error has occurred...
errormessage.:comment.text: %1$s is the message being displayed.  %2$s and %3s are replaced with values that generate a url the user can click on to report the bug.

allprojects.title: Your ${objectnames.plural.project} (%1$s)
allprojects.:comment.title: %1$s is the number of projects the user has.
allprojects.tooltip: Double click to add a new ${objectnames.singular.project}.

importfile.tooltip: Click to create a new ${objectnames.singular.project} by importing a file.

labels.:comment.editcomplete: %1$s is the percentage complete.  The double % is needed to output a single %.
labels.:comment.readability: %1$s is the Flesch Kincaid grade level, %2$s is the Flesch Reading ease level, $3$s is the Gunning Fox Index.

findprojects.:comment.details: %1$s is the current folder being searched.

popup.title: Find in progress
popup.text: A search for your ${objectnames.plural.project} is currently in progress.

popup.title: Find your ${objectnames.plural.project}
popup.text:
This function allows you to find your ${objectnames.plural.project}. It is useful if you are using Dropbox or another file syncing service or just need to rebuild your ${objectnames.plural.project} database.

Use the box below to select a starting directory then press ${allprojects.actions.findprojects.popup.buttons.find}, {QW} will then search your file system for ${objectnames.plural.project} and it will add them automatically.

finder.title: Select a folder
finder.tooltip: Click to find a starting folder

tooltips.error:
This ${objectnames.singular.project} cannot be opened for the following reason:

%1$s

Right click to remove this from your list of ${objectnames.plural.project}.
tooltips.:comment.error: %1$s is the reason why the project can't be opened.
tooltips.encrypted: This ${objectnames.singular.project} is encrypted and needs a password to access it.  Click to open it.
tooltips.editor: You are editing this ${objectnames.singular.project} for %1$s. Click to open it.
tooltips.:comment.editor: %1$s is the editor name or email address.
tooltips.warmups: This is your ${objectnames.plural.warmup} ${objectnames.singular.project}.  Click to open it.

popup.title: Unable to open ${objectnames.singular.project}
popup.text:
Sorry, ${objectnames.singular.project} %1$s cannot be opened for the following reason:

%2$s

This can happen if your projects file gets out of sync with your hard drive, for example if you have re-installed your machine or if you are using a file syncing service.

Do you want to remove it from your list of ${objectnames.plural.project}?

Note: this will only remove the ${objectnames.singular.project} from the list it will not remove any other data.
popup.:comment.text: %1$s is the name of the project, %2$s is the reason why the project can't be opened.

changedisplay.actionerror: Unable to update ${objectnames.plural.project} with the new format.

problemfinder.nexterror: Unable to find the next problem.

ignored.single: 1 problem has been ignored in this ${objectnames.singular.chapter}, click to un-ignore it.
ignored.plural: %1$s problems have been ignored ${objectnames.singular.chapter}, click to un-ignore them.

title.tooltip: Click to open/close the items below.

wordcount.title: Word Counts
wordcount.helplink:
Click to find out more about
the Readability indices
wordcount.:comment.valuepercent: This is used whenever a 'words with percentage' value is output, such as 1,000 / 10%.  %1$s is the number of words.  %2$s is the percentage.  The %% is needed to output a single %.

labels.:comment.sparkline7days: %1$s is the number of days the sparkline is showing.  %2$s is a +/- indicator showing whether the word count has gone up or down.  %3$s is the number of words.
labels.:comment.sparkline30days: %1$s is a +/- indicator showing whether the word count has gone up or down.  %2$s is the number of words.

confirmpopup.:comment: The items here assume the plural case for problems to un-ignore, this is to simplify things.

confirmpopup.text:
Please confirm you wish to un-ignore %1$s problems for rule

%2$s
confirmpopup.:comment.text: %1$s here is the number of problems that will be un-ignored or be able to be found again.  %2$s is the description of the rule.

ignored.single: 1 problem for this rule has been ignored, click to un-ignore it.
ignored.plural: %1$s problems for this rule have been ignored, click to un-ignore them.
ignored.:comment.plural: %1$s is the number of problems (greater than 1) that have been ignored for the problem.

options.tooltip: Click to view the the options

items.:comment.deleteall: %1$s is the object type plural name for the asset type.

deletetag.:comment.text: %1$s is the tag that will be removed/deleted.  For a single project the tag is just removed or made unavailable.  If removed from all projects then it is deleted completely.

splitchapter.title: Split {Chapter}
splitchapter.:comment.moretextindicator: The ellipsis here, in English, indicates that there is more text available.  i.e. there is more to come in this ...

errors.valueexists: A {chapter} with that name already exists.

editchapter.:comment.actionerror: %1$s is the name of the chapter.

deletechapter.:comment.actionerror: %1$s is the name of the chapter.

renameproject.title: Rename {Project}
renameproject.text: Enter the new {project} name below.  The {project} will then be closed and re-opened.

errors.valueexists: A {project} with that name already exists.

enterpasswordpopup.title: Enter password
enterpasswordpopup.text: {Project}: %1$s is encrypted, please enter the password.

errors.projectalreadyopen: Sorry, the {project} appears to already be open in {QW}.  Please close all other instances of {QW} first before trying to open the {project}.

openerrors.:comment: These are error messages that may be displayed when a user is unable to open a project.
openerrors.:comment.general: %1$s is the project name.  %2$s is the reason which will be one of the reasons from this section.
openerrors.projectdirisfile: Path to {project} %1$s is a file, but a directory is expected.
openerrors.:comment.projectdirisfile: %1$s is the expected project directory.  This error occurs when the project directory is actually a file.
openerrors.invalidprojectdir: {Project} directory %1$s doesn't appear to be a valid {QW} {project}.
openerrors.cantfindeditor: Unable to find {contact}: %1$s you are editing the {project} for.
openerrors.:comment.cantfindeditor: %1$s is the email address of the contact/editor the user is editing the project for.

deleteproject.:comment: The delete project function uses the generic 'Delete item' function and thus is based on the values from [deleteitem] rather than having its own values here.
deleteproject.:comment.actionerror: %1$s is the name of the project.

warning.normal: Warning!  Once deleted a {chapter} cannot be restored.
warning.editor: A message will also be sent to %1$s telling them you are no longer editing the {project}.
warning.:comment.editor: %1$s is the name/email address of the person the user is editing the project for.  This message is shown when the user is editing the project for someone else.  The normal message is always shown, so this message acts as a suffix.

projectopen.title: ${objectnames.singular.project} already open
projectopen.text: %1$s is currently already open in a window. Please delete the ${objectnames.singular.project} from that window or close the ${objectnames.singular.project} then delete it from here.

confirmpopup.:comment: This popup is shown when the user is editing the project for someone else.
confirmpopup.title: {Project} deleted
confirmpopup.text: The {project} has been deleted and a message has been sent to %1$s to let them know.
confirmpopup.:comment.text: %1$s is the name/email address of the person the user is editing the project for.

viewaddasset.:comment.actionerror: %1$s is the object name for the asset.

deleteasset.:comment.actionerror: %1$s is the object name of the asset.  %2$s is the name of the asset.

popup.title: Report a Bug/Problem
popup.text:
Complete the form below to report a bug/problem. The email address is optional, only provide it if you would like a response.

The operating system you are using and the Java version will also be sent (it helps with debugging). No personal information will be sent.

Please consider checking the box to send a screenshot, it helps a lot.
popup.errorlabel: Please enter a description of the problem/bug.

description.tooltip: Enter the bug/problem description here.  The more information you can provide the better.

sendscreenshot.text: Send a screenshot of current window
sendscreenshot.tooltip: Takes a screenshot of the current window and sends it to support.  If you have information you would prefer not to share then please change the tab before sending.  Uncheck to not send a screenshot, but please remember a picture is worth 1,000 (and more) words.

confirmpopup.title: Problem/Bug reported
confirmpopup.text: Thank you, the problem has been logged with {QW} support.  If you provided an email address then you should get a response within 2-3 days.  If not feel then free to send the message again.

popup.title: Contact Support
popup.text: Use the form below to contact {QW} support.  If you wish to receive a response then please provide an email address.

confirmpopup.title: Message sent
confirmpopup.text: Your request has been logged with {QW} support.  If you provided an email address then you should get a response within 1-2 days.  If not feel then free to send the message again.

editorsserviceregister.tooltip: Click to register for the Editors Service

betabug.tooltip: Click to report a bug/problem with the beta

warmup.tooltip: Click to do a new ${objectnames.singular.warmup} exercise

fullscreen.tooltip: Click to work in full screen mode
